alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 12 at 7:43AM EDT until July 12 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. For the Lamoille River...including East Georgia, Johnson, Jeffersonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Impacts until the river falls below 450.0 feet...Road flooding will continue in and around Cambridge Village. Widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville through Fairfax will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 451.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 447.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EDT Wednesday was 456.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 448.1 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 454.5 feet during the Halloween Storm on 11/01/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EDT.
